toc_entry.title: Moon Struck
toc_entry.description: Ten years ago the apollo astronauts, technicians and scientists all, landed on the Moon and touched what poets only dreamed. But that touch changed their lives.

toc_entry.title: The Ten Best And the Ten Worst Legislators
toc_entry.description: We just rate them. You voted for them.

toc_entry.title: Conspicuous Consumption
toc_entry.description: China, crystal, waiters in tuxedos. That’s what we love about Tony’s.

toc_entry.title: Speed Freak
toc_entry.description: A MacDonald’s is a MacDonald’s is a MacDonald’s. That’s what we love about fast food.

toc_entry.title: All God’s Chitlins
toc_entry.description: Simmering pots of soul food. That’s what we love about the South.

toc_entry.title: To Each His Own
toc_entry.description: Famous people, obscure people, fat people, skinny people all have to eat. That’s what we love about people.

toc_entry.title: Counter Culture
toc_entry.description: Strawberry sodas, vanilla Cokes, grilled cheese sandwiches. That’s what we love about soda fountains.

toc_entry.title: Hi, Mabel. Give Me the Usual.
toc_entry.description: Friendly faces in friendly places. That’s what we love about our old favorites.

toc_entry.title: Baby And Me And Ddt
toc_entry.subtitle: Health
toc_entry.description: Experts say that the chemical residues in mother’s milk aren’t enough to harm a nursing baby, but how much poison is too much?

toc_entry.title: Type Caste
toc_entry.subtitle: Working
toc_entry.description: Staying up all night setting type may not sound like the good life, but it is.

toc_entry.title: Haute As a Pistol
toc_entry.subtitle: Stepping Out
toc_entry.description: A Paris fashion show and the cotton-eyed Joe, nowhere but Texas.

toc_entry.title: The Lord Is In HIs Temple
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: Congregation Beth Israel in Houston remembers the Holocaust quietly; allandale Baptist Church in austin isn’t quiet about anything.

toc_entry.title: Eagle’s Eye
toc_entry.subtitle: Film
toc_entry.description: The Whole Shootin’ Match is a Texas film with Texas actors that took a year to get shown in Texas.

toc_entry.title: After the Honeymoon

toc_entry.description: Talent marries business sense at Dallas’ Theater Onstage.

toc_entry.title: Talent Clout
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Houston Opera Studio’s students learn their way into the limelight.

toc_entry.title: Breeden Ground
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: Leon Breeden’s jazz students at North Texas State University are already pros, and they have recorded two new albums to prove it.

toc_entry.title: The Collector
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Did Helmut Gernsheim make a mistake when he sold his priceless photography collection to UT?

toc_entry.title: Wind, Winter, And Waste
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Five new books: three thrillers, one chiller, and a swan song.

toc_entry.title: For the Good Of the Country
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Neither the Lone Star Cafe nor Debby Boone is what country music is all about, and a few Texas citizens are trying to set the record straight.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Fill ’er up, but don 7 spill any gas on my Ralph Lauren boots.

toc_entry.description: Space cadet.

toc_entry.description: Card tricks and vintage flicks.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: The Texas Monthly Reporter
toc_entry.description: Suffering the lines at the gas pump; gambling in the magazine business; a dragnet for the Southwest’s sneakiest thief; what’s Dallas’ secret?

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Texas real estate up for grabs; will Houston get a third daily newspaper?
